title: After system reset, League will not launch into game (Mac)
body:
Recently, I had reset my computer (for reasons of my own). However, after I downloaded league again, I can not launch into the game. To be clear, I *can* log into the client, but if I go through champion select, it will throw me a "Reconnect" button and the game will not launch. Both league and my OS are updated to the latest version.

[Image](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1OIPDinwUFzTWrueVpVfYRqd7pnPKmIpl)

I have seen some others with this issue, but they were all windows users and their fixes were not applicable to me.

Things I tried:

**Press the Reconnect button**:
Nothing happened.

**League's "Full Repair" tool**:
Clicked full repair, let the tool finish troubleshooting. However no issues were found, and the problem was not fixed.

**Hextech Repair Tool**:
Downloaded and launched this tool, but I can't see any of the words on the screen.
[Image](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1YnxSEHHpdeWt9EvnX6lfeQJ4k_xPAY8b)

**Apple's Disk Utility**:
I ran first aid on my hard drive, found no issues, and the issue was not solved.

If someone could find a solution to this fix, it would be greatly appreciated. :)

replies.body: Sometimes certain firewall settings will let you connect to the login servers and get into a game lobby, but the firewall then blocks you from connecting to the specific game server causing this to happen. Try turning off your firewalls/antivirus temporarily to test it out in custom, or add exceptions using [**these steps**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#mq3). Be sure to let me know if it doesn't work!

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=8ARj6Lra,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-01-23T01:25:45.306+0000)
>
> Sometimes certain firewall settings will let you connect to the login servers and get into a game lobby, but the firewall then blocks you from connecting to the specific game server causing this to happen. Try turning off your firewalls/antivirus temporarily to test it out in custom, or add exceptions using [**these steps**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#mq3). Be sure to let me know if it doesn't work!

It turns out that my firewall has already been turned off... I don't think I've turned it on yet. But it doesn't work if firewall is on or off. :(

Hmmm alrighty, that at least helps narrow down what the problem might be. Go ahead and try updating your DNS to 8.8.8.8/8.8.4.4 as well as double checking your Mac [**"permissions" **](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#mq9) as well. 

If these steps still don't help, shoot your game logs over to our techs in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) for them to take a much deeper look.
